meanings.definition: A shelter made of branches or turf.
meanings.sent1: The shealings provided a cozy refuge for the animals.
meanings.sent2: The shealings in the forest were perfect hiding spots for the children.
meanings.sent3: The shealings looked like little fairy houses in the meadow.
meanings.sent4: The shealings dotted the landscape like miniature forests.
meanings.sent5: The shealings blended seamlessly with the natural surroundings.

meanings.definition: The act of covering a roof with straw or other material.
meanings.sent1: The shealings of the cottage were beautifully thatched.
meanings.sent2: The shealings on the barn roof protected it from the rain.
meanings.sent3: The shealings on the house made it look like a storybook cottage.
meanings.sent4: The shealings on the roof rustled gently in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The shealings added a rustic charm to the building.

meanings.definition: The process of repairing a thatched roof.
meanings.sent1: The shealings of the old farmhouse needed regular maintenance.
meanings.sent2: The shealings involved replacing worn-out straw with fresh material.
meanings.sent3: The shealings kept the rain out after a thorough repair.
meanings.sent4: The shealings were carefully tended to by the skilled thatcher.
meanings.sent5: The shealings looked good as new after the repair work.
